docs.abstract: Doctors said the baby I carried, with Trisomy 18, Down syndrome and heart failure, was unlikely to survive. My federal insurance plan would not cover an abortion.
docs.snippet: Doctors said the baby I carried, with Trisomy 18, Down syndrome and heart failure, was unlikely to survive. My federal insurance plan would not cover an abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: Demand for infertility treatment is increasing, but so is the number of clinics offering it, and more are seeking free publicity with a method that seems jarring.

headline.seo: Ethical Questions Raised by In Vitro Raffle
headline.main: Clinic Raffles Could Make You a Winner, and Maybe a Mother
headline.print_headline: Clinic Raffles Could Make You A Winner, and Maybe a Mother

docs.abstract: Demand for infertility treatment is increasing, as is number of clinics offering it, and fertility clinics around country have begun offering promotions such as contests or raffles to garner free publicity; medical ethicists worry that contests exploit vulnerable people and trivialize human conception.
docs.snippet: Demand for infertility treatment is increasing, but so is the number of clinics offering it, and more are seeking free publicity with a method that seems jarring.

docs.lead_paragraph: Romney and Obama, listen up: rats and a girl named Kewauna may hold secrets about what the country needs.
docs.abstract: Nicholas D Kristof Op-Ed column highlights studies that have shown benefits of early childhood education and parenting programs on educational success of children; contends both presidential candidates should understand importance of investing in children as means by which to strengthen nation.
docs.snippet: Romney and Obama, listen up: rats and a girl named Kewauna may hold secrets about what the country needs.

keywords.value: How Children Succeed: Grit, Curiosity, and the Hidden Power of Character (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works

docs.abstract: Readers comment on my column about the importance of early childhood, and character skills, in determining life outcomes.
docs.snippet: Readers comment on my column about the importance of early childhood, and character skills, in determining life outcomes.

docs.lead_paragraph: As technology blurs the line between work and home, many companies are eschewing traditional benefits like bonuses for stress reducers like free housecleaning and dinner deliveries.

headline.seo: In Silicon Valley, Perks Now Begin at Home
headline.main: Housecleaning, Then Dinner? Silicon Valley Perks Come Home
headline.print_headline: Housecleaning, Then Dinner? Silicon Valley Perks Come Home

docs.abstract: Companies in Silicon Valley and elsewhere are eschewing traditional benefits like bonuses, instead offering stress-reducing services like free housecleaning and dinner deliveries; strategy is aimed at minimizing distractions and sources of tension that can inhibit focus and creativity.
docs.snippet: As technology blurs the line between work and home, many companies are eschewing traditional benefits like bonuses for stress reducers like free housecleaning and dinner deliveries.

headline.main: Behind China's High Abortion Rate: New Sexual Freedoms

docs.abstract: The one-child policy has long been cited as the reason for China's steep abortion rate, but some experts now point to another factor: Young people, they say, simply don't know how to use contraceptives.
docs.snippet: The one-child policy has long been cited as the reason for China's steep abortion rate, but some experts now point to another factor: Young people, they say, simply don't know how to use contraceptives.

docs.lead_paragraph: The bill, which allows the procedure during the first trimester for any reason, opens the way for one of the most sweeping abortion rights laws in Latin America.

headline.print_headline: Uruguay’s Senate Approves Bill Allowing First-Trimester Abortions for Any Reason

docs.abstract: Uruguay’s Senate approves bill that allows women to have abortions during first trimester of pregnancy for any reason, opening the way for one of the most sweeping abortion rights laws in Latin America.
docs.snippet: The bill, which allows the procedure during the first trimester for any reason, opens the way for one of the most sweeping abortion rights laws in Latin America.

byline.contributor: Mauricio Rabuffetti contributed reporting from Montevideo, Uruguay, Emily Schmall from Buenos Aires and Lis Horta Moriconi from Rio de Janeiro.

docs.abstract: We're getting smarter about the way we're addressing social problems. And patterns in the most effective solutions are emerging.
docs.snippet: We're getting smarter about the way we're addressing social problems. And patterns in the most effective solutions are emerging.

docs.lead_paragraph: A workplace advocate calls for legislation to require employers to provide reasonable accommodation for pregnant women.
docs.snippet: A workplace advocate calls for legislation to require employers to provide reasonable accommodation for pregnant women.

headline.main: Conservative Group Calls for Tennessee Republican's Resignation

docs.abstract: Representative Scott DesJarlais has been battered by the news media after a taped phone call of the anti-abortion Republican appeared to show him pressuring a mistress to terminate her pregnancy.
docs.snippet: Representative Scott DesJarlais has been battered by the news media after a taped phone call of the anti-abortion Republican appeared to show him pressuring a mistress to terminate her pregnancy.
